question: While examining the lateral view of the X-ray of the skull, a radiologist points out a region that is the meeting point of the parietomastoid, occipitomastoid, and lambdoid sutures. What point is he referring to?
The lymphatic drainage from the palatine tonsil drains into which of the following lymph nodes?
The auditory ossicles articulate through which kind of joint?
Which of the following branches of the maxillary artery passes through the foramen spinosum?
The transverse facial artery is a branch of which of the following?
Lymph from tongue drain in which of the following lymph nodes?
A young man had a car accident and came to the emergency room (ER) with a fracture of a facial bone that is unpaired. Which bone is involved?
Which of the following is present in the optic canal?
In the case of vitamin A deficiency, keratomalacia occurs. Which of the following characterizes this condition?

answers.option: Patient cannot see in low light or in near dark condition
Unable to see in light or dark condition

question: An oblique facial cleft is a developmental anomaly that occurs due to failure of fusion of which of the following structures?

answers.option: Two maxillary prominence with each other
Maxillary prominence with medial nasal prominence
Maxillary prominence with lateral nasal prominence
Two mandibular prominence with each other
Two medial nasal prominence with each other

question: Taste buds are present in the following papillae except:
Which is not present in the carotid sheath?
The infraorbital foramen is an opening in which of the following bones?

answers.option: Greater wing of the sphenoid bone

question: Which of the following muscles is not supplied by the mandibular nerve?
Which muscle takes part in the formation of palatine aponeurosis?
A person injures his mandible (ramus) in an accident. Which boundary of the wall of the infratemporal fossa does it form?
Aphakia is associated with which of the following?
In lateral view of an X-ray of the head, a physician notices the meeting point of parietooccipital, occipitomastoid, and lambdoid sutures. What is this point called?
Which of the following nerves provide sensory supply to the skin overlying the angle of the mandible?
A person presents with his right eye looking "down and out" with double vision (diplopia) when looking at the right. He has a lesion in which of the following nerves?
The submandibular lymph nodes are present in which triangle?
The suspensory ligaments of the eye are an extension of which of the following?

A man received a strong blow to the anterior aspect of the mandible during a fight. The tympanic plate of the external auditory meatus was affected. The temporomandibular joint has undergone which type of dislocation?
A student is studying about a muscle that forms the boundaries of both anterior and posterior triangles. Which of the following is the appropriate muscle?
Which of the following muscles causes forceful closure of the eyes?
Which structure does not pass through the superior orbital fissure?

A girl is facing pre-pubertal acne. The doctor warns her about not squeezing any pimples and prescribes her some special cream for the tip of the nose and the upper lip region acne. What is the most likely reason?

answers.option: This area is more prone to acne
This area has direct dural venous drainage
This area requires more special care than the others

question: Umami taste fibers are related to?
Myopia is corrected by what type of lens?
Which of the following structures pass through the lateral wall of the pterygopalatine fossa?
Which of the following structures forms the anterior wall of the pterygopalatine fossa?
Which part of the mandible forms the temporomandibular joint?
Which of the following is not a direct branch of the external carotid artery?
What is the position of the macula lutea relative to the optic disc in the eyeball?
Anesthesia in retromolar fossa primarily blocks which of the following nerves?
Which of the following does not take part in the formation of the carotid sheath?
Fracture of mandible most likely results in the damage of which of the following nerves?

A nerve winds around the styloid process and carries postganglionic parasympathetic fibers which stimulate salivary secretion in the submandibular and sublingual glands. What is the name of the given nerve?
Maxillary sinus drains into which of the following?
The nose has a rich vascular supply. Which of the following arteries does not directly supply the nose?
A person feels pain when drinking hot tea. On examination, the central part of the lower lip has an ulcer and associated lymph nodes are swollen. Which nodes are involved?

Preganglionic fibers for pupillary reflex reach ciliary ganglion where they synapse and form short ciliary nerves (postganglionic fibers) that innervate the eye. Preganglionic fibers reach ciliary ganglion by which of the following nerves?
For near vision, the lens is accommodated to attain increased convexity. Which of the following muscle contracts to help in this action?
A 20-year-old boy has an accident. In the accident, the floor of the temporal fossa is fractured. Which of the following structures is not affected?

A person meets an accident and loses all the salivary activity of the submandibular gland. The preganglionic parasympathetic secretomotor fibers to this gland are carried by which of the following nerves?
A patient has swelling on his face with midface mobility and malocclusion of his teeth with anterior open bite. What kind of fracture is described here/what bone is involved?
Which of the following is true about the common carotid artery?

answers.option: It divides into internal and external carotid artery at the upper border of thyroid cartilage
It has a dilatation on it just after its initiation below the bifurcation
It supplies a branch to the thyroid gland
At the right side, common carotid artery arises from the arch of aorta
At the left side, common carotid artery arises from the brachiocephalic trunk

question: Which of the following is not a content of the pterygopalatine fossa?
Which of the following muscles is attached to the posterior margin of the eyelid?
Which of the following will not be affected by damage to the superior salivatory nucleus in the pons and facial nerve nucleus lesion?

answers.option: Taste sensation from anterior two thirds

question: Damage to the right optic tract causes a defect in which field of vision?

answers.option: Contralateral nasal and contralateral temporal fields
Ipsilateral temporal and contralateral nasal fields
Ipsilateral nasal and contralateral temporal fields
Ipsilateral nasal and ipsilateral temporal fields

question: Damage to the right optic nerve will lead to which of the following?
A patient suffers damage to the orbit resulting in damage to the third cranial nerve. Which of the following signs will be present?

answers.option: Pupillary constriction and abduction of eye
Pupillary dilatation and adduction of eye
Pupillary constriction and adduction of eye
Pupillary dilatation and abduction of eye

question: The patient is having diplopia with restricted movements of the eye whenever he depresses or adducts the eye. Which nerve is affected?
Which of the following diseases is caused by the deficiency of vitamin A?
Cochlear implants are used as a treatment for which type of deafness?
A hearing aid is most useful in which of the following hearing problems?
The greatest difference of refractive indices is found at which of the following sites?

answers.option: Between aqueous humor and the anterior surface of lens
Between the posterior surface of lens and vitreous humor
Between air and anterior surface of cornea
Between posterior surface of cornea and aqueous humor

question: Vibrations in the cochlear fluid cause vibration in which of the following structures?
A patient has sensorineural deafness in the right ear. A 'tuning fork' test will indicate which of the following?

answers.option: Positive Rinne's test in right ear
Negative Rinne's test in left ear

question: A patient has conductive deafness in the left ear. Which of the following findings will help us know this?

answers.option: Positive Rinne's test in right ear
Positive Rinne's test in left ear

question: A person can not listen to low pitch sounds. Which of the following regions is involved?
A person takes aspirin for chest pain. He feels a very strong bitter taste. Which nerve is responsible for carrying taste sensation from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue?
Which of the following is the most sensitive part of the eye?
A patient comes to the outpatient department with complaints of dryness of nose and palate. Which ganglion must be damaged?
Which type of gland is the gland of Zeis?
Which part of the eye continues to grow throughout the lifetime?
Optic vesicles are out pocketings formed by which of the following structures?
The intermaxillary segment is formed by fusion of which of the following?
Which of the following structures is derived from the 1st pharyngeal arch?
An infant has a cleft on the right side of the palate behind the incisive foramen. The surgeon identifies it as which of the following?

answers.option: Unilateral cleft of primary and posterior palate

question: Which of the following is the area of epistaxis in the nose?
Which of the following structures divides the posterior triangle of the neck into two parts?
Which of the following structures forms the superior border of the digastric triangle?
Which of the following structures is involved in forming the lateral border of the muscular triangle?
Which of the following muscles is involved in shrugging of shoulders?
A chef adds too much salt to the soup by mistake. Which of the following is the appropriate area of the tongue which detects salty taste?

answers.option: Anterior U-shaped area of the tongue
Almost entire area of tongue ventrally

question: A person eats something, which is so bitter that he has to puke it out. Which of the following is the appropriate area of the tongue which detects bitter taste?

answers.option: Almost entire area of tongue ventrally
Anterior U-shaped area of the tongue

question: A person eats something and finds it to have a delicious taste called umami. Which of the following is the appropriate area of the tongue which detects umami taste?

answers.option: Anterior U-shaped area of the tongue
Almost entire area of tongue ventrally

question: A man plans to lose weight so he cuts off calories and makes a salad for himself. Upon tasting it, he finds out that there is too much lemon in it. Which of the following is the appropriate area of the tongue which detects sour taste?

answers.option: Anterior U-shaped area of the tongue
Almost entire area of tongue ventrally

question: A person eats something which is very sweet. Which of the following is the appropriate area of the tongue which detects sweet taste?

answers.option: Anterior U-shaped area of the tongue
Almost entire area of tongue ventrally

question: Which of the following is true regarding the tympanic membrane?

answers.option: Pars flaccida is the area between the umbo of malleus and the posterior malleolar fold
Malleus and incus are derived from first pharyngeal arch during embryogenesis
Footplate of stapes attaches to it

question: Which of the following is correct regarding mastoid air cells and mastoid antrum?

answers.option: The canal for facial nerve is below the aditus to the mastoid antrum
Mastoid antrum is separated from middle cranial fossa by tegmen tympani
Mastoid air cells or antrum opens on the posterior wall of external ear
Suprameatal triangle is antero-inferior to the mastoid process

question: 11-cis retinal bound to a specific protein is classified as which of the following?
A friend tells you a person's number. After a few minutes, you can not recall it. This is because it has been wiped out from which of the following?
Which of the following is true about the canal of Schlemm?

answers.option: It communicates with the vitreous chamber
It is lined by stratified squamous epithelium

question: A 45-year-old male is diagnosed with a brain tumor that is pressing on the nerve that passes through a groove between pyramids and olives. Which of the following functions would be affected?

answers.option: Taste on the ipsilateral side of the anterior two thirds of a tongue
Paralysis of all the extrinsic muscles of the tongue only
Paralysis of all the intrinsic muscles of the tongue
Taste on the ipsilateral side of the posterior one third of a tongue
General sensations on the ipsilateral side of the anterior two thirds of a tongue

question: Which of the following carries a sense of temperature directly from the anterior two-thirds of a tongue to the thalamus?

answers.option: Main sensory nucleus of trigeminal nerve
Ventro postero lateral nucleus of thalamus

question: Which of the following cells of the brain detect pressure?
A physician found an infection involving carotid sheath. Which of the following structures might be involved?
Which of the following sets of bones have a major contribution to the nasal septum?

answers.option: Vomer and perpendicular plate of ethmoid

question: Which of the following types of secretions are released into the troughs of circumvallate papillae?

answers.option: Entirely serous from Von Ebner's gland

question: Which of the following structures gives rise to the air-filled cavity present in the petrous part of the temporal bone?

Which of the following lies posterior to the maxilla, inferior and deep to the zygomatic arch and ramus of the mandible?
From which view can pterygopalatine fossa be seen best?

Which of the following structures does not pass through the internal acoustic meatus?
Which muscle must be affected if the upper eye lid is droopy (ptosis)?
Ethmoidal bulla can be seen in the middle nasal meatus. Which of the following is related to ethmoidal bulla?

Which type of secretion is produced by the glands at the tip of the tongue?
Light can not pass from which of the following layers of the eye?
Which of the following muscles would not be affected if the pharyngeal plexus, which lies deep to the middle constrictor gets damaged?
Which of the following terms is defined as the inability to see in the bright light?
Maximal movement is shown by which of the following joints when the head moves horizontally such as to say "no"?

A 7-year-old presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of difficulty in chewing and swallowing. He also complains of pain in the auricular region and external ear. After examination, the doctor finds that there is an inflammation of the parotid gland. Which of the following nerves must be irritated to cause this pain?
Which of the following is an active metabolite of vitamin A present in the eye?
Which of the following are the end products of hydrolysis of retinyl esters in intestinal mucosa?

answers.option: Retinoic acid and free fatty acids

question: Which of the following muscles is attached to the articular disc of the temporomandibular joint?
Which of the following muscles are involved in the formation of transverse and vertical wrinkles on the forehead?
Which of the following contains receptors to detect centrifugal acceleration in order to determine angular acceleration?

Which of the following triangles of neck contains chemoreceptors?

Which of the following suprahyoid muscles is supplied by C1 fibers along the hypoglossal nerve?
Which of the following nerves does not pass through the jugular foramen?
Which of the following is correct about the nerve that is responsible for the physiological peristaltic movements of the gastrointestinal tract?

answers.option: Joined by cranial part of accessory nerve
Does not give cardiac branches in the neck

question: Which of the following regions has the most abundant distribution of fungiform papillae?
Which of the following correctly describes the cause of the coloboma?

answers.option: Failure of optic cup to close
Failure of lens vesicle to close
Failure of choroidal fissure to close

question: Which of the following correctly describes the function of the myenteric plexus in causing the peristaltic movements of the gut?

answers.option: Inhibiting circular muscle below the bolus
Inhibiting longitudinal muscles below the bolus
Stimulating circular muscles above the bolus
Inhibiting circular muscle above the bolus

question: Which of the following nerves supplies the anterior aspect of the external auditory meatus?

Which of the following is responsible for the detection of the direction from which the sound is coming?

Nucleus ambigous does not give fibers to which of the following?
A person comes to the clinic with complaints of drooping of the right upper eyelid and inability to keep his right eye open. Which of the following muscles is most likely involved?
Which of the following are found abundantly in the fovea?

A few students while conducting research found that some areas of the tongue are stimulated when they get in touch with ionized molecules. Which of the following taste sensations will be produced by these ionized molecules?

Which of the following is a voluntary phase of swallowing?
Which of the following is the most important process in swallowing that prevents the entry of food into the larynx?
